p: Mayaro virus (MAYV) is a positive-sense, enveloped, singlestranded RNA alphavirus classified in the Semliki Complex. MAYV is the etiological agent of Mayaro fever ( 1). The Semliki Complex is made up of eight viruses of importance in the medical and veterinary fields: Bebaru, Chikungunya, Getah, Mayaro, Oâ€™nyong-nyong, Ross River, Semliki Forest, and Una ( 1). Due to the fact that these eight viruses belong to the same serological complex, it is difficult to achieve an accurate diagnosis of the viruses outside of well-equipped laboratory settings ( 1). Further, the virus is closely related to and cocirculates with Venezuelan equine encephalitis and Chikungunya viruses ( 2).
